name: Welcome to San Diego, Now Go Home! Quiz | Geography | 15 Questions

questions.text: For the first few questions, let's deal with the natural wonders of San Diego County. Which of the following varmints is not found in San Diego or its waters?
questions.correct: All are found in San Diego
questions.explanation:
All are found in San Diego.

	Great whites have been sighted off the coast of La Jolla, where they feed on abundant seals.

questions.text: What delightful insect, abundant in San Diego County, has several locations named after it, notably Las Pulgas Road in Oceanside?
questions.explanation:
The flea.

	San Diego, with its warm climate, is a mecca for fleas.

questions.text: What superabundant San Diego plant is a master of disguise, sometimes covering streamside banks with lush vines, other times lining trails with shrubs, and in winter with leafless, unrecognizable branches?
questions.explanation:
Poison oak.

	I know several people that have needed visits to the doctor after contact with this fine flora, including myself!

questions.text: Iris McKenna, a birdwatcher, earned her San Diego fame in an unusual way in Cuyamaca State Park. How?
questions.correct: She was eaten by a mountain lion
options: She climbed Stonewall Peak in record time
She was assaulted by an eager ground squirrel
questions.explanation:
She was eaten by a mountain lion.

	Mountain lions really are inoffensive animals- most of the time.

questions.text: Had enough of nature? How about tourist attractions? Kandu the killer whale provided audiences an unforgettable show at Sea World. How?
questions.correct: She was rammed by a tankmate and bled to death
options: She jumped out of her tank
questions.explanation:
She was rammed by a tankmate and bled to death.

	Unfortunately, animals such as killer whales, used to roaming huge areas of oceans, sometimes are driven crazy by captivity. Many locals call Sea World 'Tank World' or 'Whale Jail.'

questions.text: Which of the following acts has not been committed by the San Diego Zoo?
questions.correct: The Zoo has done all of these.
options: Selling surplus animals that wound up on hunting ranches
Selling surplus monkeys to research facilities
Killing newborn animals that were 'too common'
questions.explanation:
The Zoo has done all of these.

	San Diego Zoo and Sea World are real friends of animals, eh?

questions.text: So how about a trip to the beach? San Diego County beaches often sport bright orange warning signs advising swimmers to stay out of the water. Why?
questions.explanation:
Bacterial contamination.

	The water is often polluted, especially after rainstorms which wash junk down the San Diego River. Raw sewage from Tijuana also poses a problem.

questions.text: Swimmers at the Childrens' Pool in La Jolla face a different problem. What is keeping the children out of the Children's Pool?
questions.explanation:
Seal poop.

	Harbor seals rest on the beach and poop in the water.

questions.text: Had enough of the ocean? How about a trip to one of San Diego's lakes, all man-made? What activity can you NOT perform at any lake in San Diego County?
questions.explanation:
Swimming.

	None of the lakes in San Diego allow swimming.

questions.text: So you want to move here still? What was the median price of a 3 bedroom home in San Diego in 1999, according to the CA. Association of Realtors?
questions.explanation:
245,910.

	A 2004 update- it's now up to $405,000!

questions.text: Home too expensive? How about renting? How much would the average 2-bedroom apartment rent for, according to an article in 2000 in the San Diego Union-Tribune?
questions.explanation:
743 dollars.

	This also has risen astronomically since this quiz was written in 2000.

questions.text: Think you can afford to rent? How will you find an apartment? According to the San Diego Union Tribune, the average vacancy rate in San Diego County (as of 2000) is
questions.explanation:
2 percent.

	Most apartments have dozens of applicants for every vacancy. The vacancy rate in the more desirable areas of the county is less than one percent.

questions.text: So you found somewhere to live- somehow. You drive to work on I-15, the main freeway linking North County communities to San Diego. On the average, how many hours will you waste every year in traffic jams?
And, once you have afforded somewhere to live, you have to be able to keep your stuff! According to the FBI, what was the 1998 rate of FBI-reportable crimes per 1000 people in San Diego?
questions.explanation:
39.

	FBI-reportable crimes are homicide, rape, robbery, aggravated assault, burglary, larceny and motor vehicle theft.

questions.text: OK, forget this stuff and let's take a trip to the California mecca- the shopping mall. San Diego's Mission Valley and Fashion Valley malls have a problem. What is it?
questions.correct: They are built in a floodplain
options: They cannot be accessed by freeway
They were built on an earthquake fault
questions.explanation:
They are built in a floodplain.

	Every year during the winter rains, cars attempt to ford flooded streets and get stuck.
